message_1: Prove the propositional formula p → p ∧ q using natural deduction.
message_2:
To prove the propositional formula p → p ∧ q using natural deduction, we will use the following rules: 

1. Assumption (AS)
2. Conjunction Introduction (∧I)
3. Implication Introduction (→I)

Here's the proof:

1. p (AS) - We assume p is true.
2. p ∧ q (AS) - We assume q is true.
3. p ∧ q (∧I 1,2) - From 1 and 2, we can introduce the conjunction p ∧ q.
4. p → (p ∧ q) (→I 1-3) - From the assumption of p in step 1, we can introduce the implication p → (p ∧ q).

Therefore, we have proven the propositional formula p → p ∧ q using natural deduction.
